titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chris Johnson farmworker photographs, 1990s RL.10065
titlestmt.author: Levi Crews and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 16:44:10 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection comprises 124 black-and-white digital photographic prints taken by North Carolina photographer Chris Johnson, portraying North Carolina farmworkers and migrant laborers in work settings as well as in their field camps and homes, many of which are revealed as dilapidated and unsanitary. Several series document labor organization and protests, including a five-year strike protesting working conditions for Mount Olive Pickle company workers. Other subjects in the images include the children and families of the farmworkers; volunteer teachers and organizers, some of whom are from the organization Student Action with Farmworkers; tobacco and Christmas tree growing in North Carolina; and street scenes from the border crossing areas of Brownsville, Texas and Matamoros, Mexico. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection. All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Chris Johnson farmworker photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in May 2013.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.
Photographs in the collection may not be reproduced without permission from the photographer.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in the following topical series designated by the photographer: Pesticides, Tobacco, Cabbage, Housing, Christmas Trees, Family and Culture, Mount Olive Boycott, Organizing and Education, Beyond Farmwork, and La Frontera (The Border).

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises 124 black-and-white photographic prints taken by North Carolina photographer Chris Johnson, portraying North Carolina farmworkers and migrant laborers in work settings as well as in their field camps and homes, many of which are revealed as dilapidated and unsanitary. Several series document labor organization and protests, including a five-year strike protesting working conditions for Mount Olive Pickle company workers. Other subjects in the images include the children and families of the farmworkers; volunteer teachers and organizers, some of whom are from the organization Student Action with Farmworkers; tobacco and Christmas tree growing in North Carolina; and street scenes from the border crossing areas of Brownsville, Texas and Matamoros, Mexico.
The prints measure 13x19 inches and are unmatted.
Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Chris Johnson is a documentary and fine art photographer based in North Carolina.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Student Action with Farmworkers records, 1950-2010; Rubenstein Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Chris Johnson farmworker photographs were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in May 2013.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Chris Johnson farmworker photographs, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2013-0196
